acceptedAnswer.text: No. Aviator uses provably fair RNG. Each round is independent and unpredictable. Predictor apps are scams or malware.
No. Aviator's crash point is generated via SHA-256 hashing. You'd need future server seeds to "predict" it—which is impossible.
Yes. Low-multiplier cashout (1.5x-2x), Fibonacci progression, and bankroll management (1-2% rule) are legitimate strategies. They don't beat the house edge, but they help you play smarter.
Low-multiplier cashout (1.5x-2x) + 1-2% bankroll management. High win probability, low variance, extends playtime. Not profitable long-term (-EV), but better than chasing losses.
Affiliate commissions. Many "Aviator predictor" videos are affiliate scams. The creator gets paid when you download the app or sign up through their link.
No — if you play at provably fair casinos (Stake, BC.Game, etc.). You can verify every round was generated fairly using the provably fair system. Rigged Aviator exists at shady casinos—avoid them.
